abstract: Bank of America formally denied S.E.C. claims accusing the bank of misleading shareholders about bonuses it let Merrill Lynch pay employees before the companies’ Jan. 1 merger, and said it was seeking an order dismissing the regulator’s complaint.
snippet: Bank of America formally denied S.E.C. claims accusing the bank of misleading shareholders about bonuses it let Merrill Lynch pay employees before the companies’ Jan. 1 merger, and said it was seeking an order dismissing the regulator’s complaint.
lead_paragraph: Bank of America formally denied claims by the Securities and Exchange Commission accusing the bank of misleading shareholders about bonuses it let Merrill Lynch pay employees before the companies’ Jan. 1 merger, and said it is seeking an order dismissing the regulator’s complaint.

headline.main: Bank of America Rejects S.E.C. Claims in Bonus Suit

abstract: Ohio’s attorney general, Richard Cordray, said Monday that investors in his class-action lawsuit against Bank of America were trying to collect billions of dollars in damages resulting from the Merrill Lynch takeover.
snippet: Ohio’s attorney general, Richard Cordray, said Monday that investors in his class-action lawsuit against Bank of America were trying to collect billions of dollars in damages resulting from the Merrill Lynch takeover.
lead_paragraph: Now it’s Ohio turn to pummel Bank of America for the Merrill Lynch deal.

headline.main: Ohio Seeks Billions From BofA in Lawsuit
